name: Acetylcysteine
sideEffects: Side effects that may arise but are rare are pyrosis, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. In some limited cases, stomatitis, dizziness and ringing in the ears, tinnitus, occur
After using NAC, allergic reactions sometimes occur such as itching, urticaria, cutaneous eruption rash, exanthema, difficulty breathing, bronchospasm, rapid heart rate, and hypotension.

The occurrence of cases in the majority of patients with hyperreactivity in the bronchial system following bronchial asthma is called hyper responders, namely patients with increased sensitivity due to various stimuli. Then hemorrhage occurs after administering NAC, related to individual hypersensitivity reactions

Actions that must be taken if side effects occur starting from the initial hypersensitivity reaction, stop using NAC immediately, consult a doctor for further action based on the severity of the disease
